title: 3 dead, 3 injured after shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people were killed and three injured in a shooting at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.
The shooting at the high school hockey game was called a 'targeted family dispute' by Pawtucket Mayor Donald Grebien.
A North Smithfield father disarmed the shooter, who had a second weapon; identities of victims remain undisclosed.

title: Jaylen Brown calls out city of Beverly Hills for shutting down his All-Star Weekend event
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown's All-Star Weekend event in Beverly Hills was shut down by police for lacking a permit.
Brown claims the event, held at James Jannard's mansion, did not require a permit and criticizes the city's actions.
The City of Beverly Hills stated that a permit was denied due to past violations at the event location.

title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco, 26, and Brandon Baez, 23, sentenced for stealing and fraudulently depositing checks from USPS mail.
Rios-Franco sentenced to 35 months prison, Baez to 24 months; both face supervised release and ordered to pay restitution.
Scheme involved washing mail checks with chemicals and depositing them into controlled bank accounts, active from 2023 to 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE, invited by Rep. Seth Moulton to State of the Union.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 on a 'collateral arrest'; his visa had expired unknowingly.
Community support surged with protests after Gomes' detention, highlighting immigration system flaws, per Moulton.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a goal from center ice during the U.S. win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman humorously responded to a theory about visible issues affecting his goaltending, citing his colorblindness.
Team USA still defeated Denmark with strong offense and is set for another game before the elimination rounds.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum nears return from Achilles injury, missing NBA All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant expects Tatum to deliver All-Star level performances upon his return, drawing on his own Achilles recovery.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return could make the Celtics a formidable playoff threat alongside Jaylen Brown.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space, with targets like Colts WR Alec Pierce as potential free agent additions.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker and Bills C Connor McGovern are considered strong fits to bolster Patriots' offensive line.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are potential targets to strengthen Patriots' key positions.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN has become the new streaming home for MLB, with MLB.TV available as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, while non-subscribers pay $149.99, including a free month trial of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will automatically renew and can use ESPN's app after linking their MLB.TV subscription.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, raising speculation about his return from an Achilles tear.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, but no return date is confirmed yet.
Tatum remains on the Celtics' injury report as out, with no timetable for his return provided by the team.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the U.S. according to a WalletHub analysis for 2026.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have advanced degrees, both highest in the nation.
Vermont and Maryland follow Massachusetts in the ranking, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia are at the bottom.
